ul.li1: 1Look! here is my servant; I hold him,
ul.li2: my chosen one, in whom my soul delights.
ul.li1: I have putLiterally “given” my spirit on him;
ul.li2: he will bring justice forth to the nations.
ul.li1: 2He will not cry out and lift up
ul.li2: and make his voice heard in the street.
ul.li1: 3He will not break a broken reed,
ul.li2: and he not will extinguish a dim wick.
ul.li3: He will bring justice forth inOr “to” faithfulness.
ul.li1: 4He will not grow faint,
ul.li2: and he will not be broken
ul.li1: until he has established justice in the earth.
ul.li2: And the coastlands wait for his teaching.
ul.li1: 5Thus says the God, Yahweh,
ul.li2: who created the heavens
ul.li1: and stretched them out,
ul.li2: who spread out the earth and its offspring,
ul.li1: who gives breath to the people upon it
ul.li2: and spirit to those who walk in it.
ul.li1: 6“I am Yahweh; I have called you in righteousness,
ul.li2: and I have grasped your hand and watched over you;
ul.li1: and I have given you as a covenant of the people,
ul.li2: as a light of the nations,
ul.li1: 7to open the blind eyes,
ul.li2: to bring the prisoner out from the dungeon,
ul.li3: those who sit in darkness from the house of imprisonment.

chapter.p: 8I am Yahweh; that is my name,

ul.li1: and I do not give my glory to another,
ul.li2: norOr “and” my praise to the idols.
ul.li1: 9Look! the former things have come,
ul.li2: and I declare new things.
ul.li3: I announceLiterally “cause to hear” them to you before they sprout up.”

chapter.pericope: A Song of Praise to Yahweh

ul.li1: 10Sing a new song to Yahweh;
ul.li2: praise him from the end of the earth,
ul.li1: youOr “those” who go down to the sea and that which fills it,
ul.li2: the coastlands and their inhabitants.
ul.li1: 11Let the desert and its towns lift up their voice,
ul.li2: the villages that Kedar inhabits.
ul.li1: Let the inhabitants of Sela sing for joy;
ul.li2: let them shout loudly from the topLiterally “head” of the mountains.
ul.li1: 12Let them giveOr “establish” glory to Yahweh
ul.li2: and declare his praise in the coastlands.
ul.li1: 13Yahweh goes forth like a mighty warrior;
ul.li2: he stirs up zeal like a man of war.
ul.li1: He raises the war cry, indeed he raises the battle shout;
ul.li2: he prevails against his foes.
ul.li1: 14I have been silent for a long time;
ul.li2: I have kept silent;
ul.li1: I have restrained myself like one giving birth;
ul.li2: I will moan, pant, and gasp together.
ul.li1: 15I will cause mountains and hills to dry up,
ul.li2: and I will cause all their herbage to wither;
ul.li1: and I will make rivers like islands,
ul.li2: and I will cause pools to dry up.
ul.li1: 16And I will lead the blind by a road they do not know;
ul.li2: I will cause them to tread on paths they have not known.
ul.li1: I will make darkness in their presenceLiterally “before their face” into light
ul.li2: and rough places into level ground.
ul.li1: These are the things I will do,
ul.li2: and I will not forsake them.
ul.li1: 17They shall turn back;
ul.li2: they shall be greatly ashamed,Literally “ashamed with shame”
ul.li1: those who trust in an image,
ul.li2: who say to a cast image, “You are our gods.”

ul.li1: 18Deaf people, listen!
ul.li2: And blind people, look to see!
ul.li1: 19Who is blind but my servant
ul.li2: orOr “and” deaf like my messenger whom I sent?
ul.li1: Who is blind like the one who is repaid
ul.li2: orOr “and” blind like the servant of Yahweh?
ul.li1: 20You see many things, butOr “and” you do not observe.
ul.li2: His ears are open, butOr “and” he does not hear.
ul.li1: 21Yahweh was willing for the sake of his righteousness;
ul.li2: he showed his teaching to be great and proved it to be glorious.
ul.li1: 22ButOr “And” this is a people plundered and looted; all of them are trapped in holes,
ul.li2: and they are kept hidden in houses of imprisonment.
ul.li1: They have become like plunder, and there is no one who saves;
ul.li2: like booty, and there is no one who says, “Restore!”
ul.li1: 23Who among you will heed this,
ul.li2: will listen attentively and listen, for the time to come?Literally “later”
ul.li1: 24Who gave Jacob to a plundererThe reading tradition (Qere) has “as plunder”
ul.li2: and Israel to those who plunder?

chapter.p: Was it not Yahweh, against whomOr “this” we have sinned?

ul.li1: And they were not willing to walk in his ways,
ul.li2: and they would not obeyLiterally “hear” his law.
ul.li1: 25SoOr “and” he poured the wrath of his anger upon him
ul.li2: and the strength of war.
ul.li1: And it set him afire all around, butOr “and” he did not understand;Or “did not know”
ul.li2: and it burned him, butOr “and” he did not take it to heart.
